emergencyFundStatus.urgency: CRITICAL - $300 will not cover even one emergency. This is the #1 risk factor.

promotionalDebtSummary.strategy: Eliminate in order of deadline, starting with PayPal Credit promos expiring 01/11/26. With $500/month extra payment capacity, can eliminate all by May 2026 and save $1,972.22.
promotionalDebtSummary.note: CRITICAL: Must pay $5,739.61 by various deadlines to avoid $1,972.22 in deferred interest charges

loans.recommendation: Nearly complete - only 14 payments ($4,398.64) remaining. LOW rate (4.25%). Pay on schedule, do NOT accelerate.
loans.note: Payoff in 2 months. After payoff, $322.60/month freed for other debts or retirement contributions.

loans.recommendation: CRITICAL CONCERN: 8.50% APR is HIGHER than SPS mortgage (8.375%) and HIGHER than all MMI credit cards (3.2%-16.3%). Consider accelerating after SoFi eliminated.
loans.note: Borrowing from retirement = losing market returns (7-10% historically) + paying 8.50% interest. Double cost. Accelerating payoff would free $828.53/month for retirement contributions.

retirementImpact.note: Each dollar in 401k loans has DOUBLE COST: (1) Not earning market returns ~8%, (2) Paying 8.50% interest on Loan 2. Total cost ~$6,186/year opportunity + interest.

retirement401kLoansAnalysis.strategyRecommendation: Loan 1: Pay on schedule (nearly done). Loan 2: Consider accelerating after SoFi 17.89% eliminated. 8.50% APR makes this higher priority than most MMI debts and even SPS mortgage.
retirement401kLoansAnalysis.urgency: Loan 2 at 8.50% should be targeted after promotional deadlines and SoFi 17.89% eliminated. Freeing $828.53/month would restore retirement contributions 4 years earlier (2025 vs 2029).

monthlyInterestCosts.note: Total monthly interest: $4,616.88 (18.8% of income). Unsecured: $2,532.26. Mortgages: $3,103.62.

cashFlowAnalysis.note: 45.7% DTI is HIGH (typical mortgage-only guideline is 28-36%), but with $294K annual income and $13,315 remaining after debt service, household can sustain this level with discipline. CRITICAL: Build emergency fund to protect cash flow.
cashFlowAnalysis.mitigationRequired: 1) Build $1,000 emergency fund immediately, 2) Eliminate promotional debt bombs to free cash flow, 3) Attack SoFi 17.89% to reduce interest bleeding

primaryResidenceLoanCare.rationale: 4.875% is a reasonable rate for a primary mortgage. Focus extra payments on higher-rate unsecured debts. Only consider extra payments after all unsecured debt >5% eliminated.

investmentPropertySPS.rationale: 8.375% is higher than primary mortgage but still lower than SoFi (17.89%), Amex cards (28.74%), Capital One (27.99-28.74%), Navy Federal 16.3%, Aven (13.49%), and Johns Hopkins 401k Loan 2 (8.50%). Pay minimums while focusing on these higher-rate unsecured debts. Consider refinancing if rates drop below 7%.
investmentPropertySPS.investmentPropertyNote: May also consider selling property to accelerate debt payoff if rental income doesn't cover costs or if appreciation justifies sale.

mortgageAnalysis.combinedStrategy: Pay minimums on both mortgages ($5,135.57/month total). Focus entire $500 extra payment on unsecured debt elimination in avalanche order. Revisit mortgage strategy after unsecured debts >8.5% eliminated (estimated 2030-2032).

mmiProgramAnalysis.recommendation: Continue MMI program as committed. $1,751/month is LOCKED. Use $500 extra payment on non-MMI high-rate debts (promotional deadlines, SoFi 17.89%, Amex cards 28.74%, then Johns Hopkins 401k Loan 2 at 8.50%).
mmiProgramAnalysis.note: Recent Navy Federal rate reductions from MMI negotiation saving $162/month ($1,945/year) in interest. This is working!

Investment property mortgage at 8.375% could be vulnerable if rental income disrupted
Tight $500/month extra payment capacity leaves little room for setbacks or errors
